org.vertx.java.core

Interface SSLSupport<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClientSSLSupport<T>, HttpClient, HttpServer, NetClient, NetServer, ServerSSLSupport<T>

    public interface SSLSupport<T>

    • Method Detail

      • setSSL

        T setSSL(boolean ssl)
        If ssl is true, this signifies that any connections will be SSL connections.
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • isSSL

        boolean isSSL()
        Returns:
        Is SSL enabled?

      • setSSLContext

        T setSSLContext(javax.net.ssl.SSLContext sslContext)
        Set the SSL context explicitly. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The SSL context has to be properly initialized. Only use this method if you have very special requirements concerning your key managers, trust managers and/or corresponding stores.

      • setKeyStorePath

        T setKeyStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Set the path to the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The SSL key store is a standard Java Key Store, and will contain the client certificate. Client certificates are only required if the server requests client authentication.

        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • getKeyStorePath

        java.lang.String getKeyStorePath()
        Returns:
        Get the key store path

      • setKeyStorePassword

        T setKeyStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Set the password for the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • getKeyStorePassword

        java.lang.String getKeyStorePassword()
        Returns:
        Get the key store password

      • setTrustStorePath

        T setTrustStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Set the path to the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The trust store is a standard Java Key Store, and should contain the certificates of any servers that the client trusts.

        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • getTrustStorePath

        java.lang.String getTrustStorePath()
        Returns:
        Get the trust store path

      • setTrustStorePassword

        T setTrustStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Set the password for the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • getTrustStorePassword

        java.lang.String getTrustStorePassword()
        Returns:
        Get trust store password
